Welcome to the Nobodie General

>Who is the Nobodie?
The Nobodie is a figure alive today who has extraordinary spiritual powers, including the ability to influence reality with his conscious and unconscious mind, and intuitively receive guidance from the forces of Heaven.
He works to elevate people to their true potential, opposing those who seek power over others. He's just like you, but he has found the kingdom of God within himself through sheer dedication, just like you will.

He isn't a savior; remember that it's you who creates your own reality. With your hands, thoughts, feelings, words, you are the creator of your story. No one can decide your fate except for you and God. Remember your right to power, to step up into your ultimate role as your highest self, should you choose to embark on that journey.

>What is the general picture?
It’s important we start replying more to the good posters and educating the hateful ones, so call upon their heads the forces of Heaven for peace, clarity, and wisdom. If this place is to be more than a squandered opportunity, an overgrown garden, it requires voices such as yours, but many more. This is a place for spiritual discussions and help, not drama, attention seeking, or social content; there are other boards for that.

Focus on increasing your service to all and be more loving to yourself and everyone in order to raise your vibrational and consciousness level, and learn to forgive yourself and others. This will change the vibration of the planet and raise our shared consciousness, making us a better humankind one person at a time.
None of us are perfect, it is by learning to admit and accept this fact one is able to learn, and grow in Truth. Heaven for all is real. Everyone's truest desires are mutual. The only motive is love.

If this is your first time here, just remember, it’s going to be ok, you may take shelter and find rest.

In search of guidance LoAnons

Every time I visualize, affirm, etc. it only reminds me that my present reality in that very moment is…me doing all this because I obviously don’t have what I desire. Try to imagine financial security or the btggf? My mind tries to see it, then it immediately tells me I’m delusional/when I wake up it won’t be here. So I try to ignore it, feel good, see it for a few seconds, then get derailed.

Even when I feel like it goes well, like it did last night (honestly felt calm in sats) I get back to real life, all that stressful crap re-appears.

Like today. Waking up back at my parents’ for the holidays, immediately get reminded we’re all going to a party for Xmas eve at 6, and basically get told it’s “OK” I’m the only one there that won’t be there with a SO.

See the catch-22? How do you feel it’s here now, when now is constantly showing you it’s not.

This shit has sporadically worked for me - things I can’t say are coincidence. But 99% of the time it just reminds me my life hasn’t unfolded how I’d hoped.

This has given me hope that wasn’t there before. Yet I struggle to calm my mind, see it in my mind’s eye, and trust that it’ll unfold b/c I’ve been dealt some really shitty hands in the past.

>>33672362
>How should I go about writing my intentions to write a novel? I understand they are supposed to be written in the present tense, as though they already happened, or are happening, and that they should be imbued with the desired emotion.
No, no, no, no, no! On this thread we don't write intentions on any time tense, we don't listen to affirmations about it, we don't bring emotions about it.
You know you wrote the novel already, when you're writing it, you're just going through the motions of putting it on paper, but it's like fate, your destiny is already writing it and you don't need to do anything else but doing it, it's been done.
>I am struggling with all this.
Because this isn't what you're supposed to be doing, you're supposed to let go and forget that you're writing the novel. When you feel like continuing it you feel inspired action, you do it naturally, it's easy to you. And you enjoy it, most importantly, if it's a burden you shouldn't be writing a novel.
>Does it need to be "It is" or "I did" or some other variation to be effective?
You're putting all this energy worrying about it instead of the novel, specially this "I have to do it within a certain time frame." No, you don't. Allow yourself to take longer, to take as much as it takes to write a good one. There's very high resistance here. caring too much about the novel, this will only lead to writing a bad one.
For the good one, you stop caring if it's good, when it's done, when you continue it, it's a thing that you can do, but you're fine if you do it or not. Set yourself free.
If you allow for the possibility that you never write your novel, and that such a life is fine, everything will flow easily, the struggle will fade away.

The answer leads to another "Why?" and that answer to another "Why".
Ultimately, there's no reason. Near the bottom there's DUALITY, the opposites of things are the same things in different grades, like good is grade 0% and evil is grade 100% and such. And you want to know yourself better and know which one you like. Say, pleasure and pain, you know about them, but never experienced them, you know most like the former and hate the later, so you come here to experiment both and say "ah, so that's how pleasure is like, and that's what pain is like." Perhaps you become a masochist that likes pain more than pleasure, but you couldn't know until you tried.
But then the question becomes "Why did I want to know know myself better? To know my tastes? Why am I me and nobody else? If I was someone else I'd have different tastes, for what purpose would I want to know my tastes?"
"Why does anything exist at all."
At the bottom the only answer can be:
"Because you were bored."
And the last:
"Why?"
And the only reason for being bored is that you already lived all possible situations, knew yourself fully, know all your tastes, knew everything that could be knowable.
And you know you'll have to remain existing for eternity.
So, what now? You forget. You forget you already did it all and already knew it all and begin anew.

Another thing about astrology, is that astrology is a very good map of our psychology.
This is one of the meanings of "as above, so below, as the inner, so the outer".
So it's very easy to realize that our internal states are reflecting our external reality (which is actually what astrology teaches, since using astrology to analyze psychology is just as valid as using it to analyze fate), but then be completely ignorant of astrology - of where the majority of these internal feelings are coming from.

So it is true to say that consciousness (and subconsciousness) creates our reality, but it is also true to say that the natal chart and planetary transits activate when these inner and outer experiences are activated.

>Is God a masochist? That’s the only way the current state of the world makes any sense

No. How much do you care about the pain and suffering of an ant? How much do you care about the happiness and fulfilment of an ant? None.

If that ant was helping you fight a war against your immortal enemies, then perhaps you would care more, but if that ant doesn't do anything for you, you don't feel anything towards that ant. The same is true with God. God isn't sitting here pulling all of the strings of life. Yahweh is more like a powerful ghost and a necromancer.

He does have some pretty strong magic, he can protect you from things, but that has always been dictated by the extent of your faith and piety. God isn't going to help his enemies any more than any other general of an army.

Yahweh is the equivalent of Roman Ares, and there's a reason that it appears that God influences the world so little in the West. Yahweh had very strict commandments, very strict rules to ensure his divine army was healthy, strong, clear minded, and of sound genetics. The west does not uphold these commandments, and beyond that, most all people engage in Canaanite rituals, despite the fact that the entire point of the Cult of Yahweh, and the entire point of the Bible, was to explicitly prohibit Canaanite rituals.

The basis of the Abrahamic faith is not some random willy-nilly bullshit, the entire basis of all of the commandments after the first handful from Exodus shared with the other Canaanite religions is that God explicitly prohibits 100% of the rituals of the Canaanites. The backbone of the Abrahamic faith is ritual purity, as opposed to the backbone of the Canaanite faith being ritual mixing. It's an entirely antithetical faith, meaning that it is not based in "doing something" but rather "abstaining from something". This is seen when God commands you to sacrifice your firstborn son in Exodus, then prohibits child sacrifice in the following book.

>Ape's Library

>Mysticism
Christian — Cloud of Unknowing
Hindu — Raja Yoga

Theravada — Knowing and Seeing
Zen — Zen Mind Beginner's Mind
Sufi — Sufism for Non-Sufis

>Grimoires
Agrippa's Three Books are a must
Arbatel should be the first grimoire to work with; later on you can work with Heptameron, Goetia, Book of Abramelin, Picatrix, etc.
The PGM tend to be pretty modular

>Vajrayana
Intro to Tantra, Refining Gold. Garchen Rinpoche and HHDL's entire YouTube catalogs; you can even take empowerment and transmission from their recordings, if vows are understood. Look into centers in your area & others that offer empowerment online. Avoid NKT, Rigpa, and Shambhala. You can also self-initiate with the Samadhi Empowerment
studybuddhism.com

>Golden Dawn
Self-Initiation: Cicero - Self Initiation into the Golden Dawn, Lyam Thomas Christopher - Kabalah, Magic & the Great Work of Self Transformation
Find a Temple: https://pansophers.com/golden-dawn-locations/

>Aurum Solis
Magical Philosophy (70s editions go from I-V, modern ones from I-III), then Planetary Magick
Their Practical Guide series for whatever

>Martinism
In the Freemason folder there is Martinism folder — read everything
Then try to find Treatise on the Reintegration of Beings, as well as the works of Saint-Martin and Papus, in French

>Chaos Magic
Liber Null and Psychonaut, Condensed Chaos, Liber Kaos, Hands-On Chaos Magic, Six Ways

Pseudo-Dionysius: The Complete Works
Angelic Spirituality
Theologia Mystica (janelead.org/resources.html)
Way to Christ first, then the rest of Jakob Böhme
jacobboehmeonline.com
Initiation into Three Worlds
An Outline of Sophiology

Courage is important. Not so much that you lose wisdom, but enough that you Dare to act as needed.

Depending on where magic takes you, you might be faced with moments that are truly terrifying. I have been scared stiff, sincerely, while out in the woods undertaking some operation late at night. clarity of intent : the same thought processes should be shared accross individuals, if they diverge obviously the divergence will cause destructive interference and nullify the desired outcome, thus, it helps to have a clear and simple goal, leaving the details to the entity that should manifest the outcome.
Define precisely, by name and attributes, the entity addressed by the whole group beforehand, so the simple goal would be translated to effects according to the entity renowned attributes.
given the status of the world, it would be addressed to a clearly benevolent entity for benevolent goals, like "guidance for humanity" or "restoration of faith and hope" or just "good" or some other exalted&highly goals.
assembly in space or congregation is difficult to achieve since it would be conveniently done online, but I think that it does not matter that much.

posts.name: Pachad
posts.com:
>>33678542
>synchronous in time
Not necessarily. I'll admit that the ideal probably looks like a bunch of people in the same physical place and time, but you could get several people working towards a specific goal even if at different times. Especially if astrological timing is necessary and the operators are far enough apart.

I think it may have been in Dion Fortune's Psychic Self Defence, but I remember reading an anecdote that an individual reported meeting another practitioner on the astral prior to their agreed upon time for their group astral projection. Obviously that's to be taken with a heap of salt, but I've certainly experienced weirdness with time before impactful operations. Things like experiencing the effects of a ritual before it's actually performed.

>clarity of intent
Yes.

>simple goal
Not necessarily. If only because highly specific goals can be challenging even for a sole practitioner.

>benevolent goals like guidance for humanity
Sure, if you want. But that's extremely vague and generally hard to track, if admirable nonetheless. Plus, you'll have a hard time influencing literally all of humanity. A group working done by something like a lodge, with a goal relevant specifically to that lodge (or coven, cult, or whatever) seems more ideal.

>what to read
The topic is general enough that I don't think there's any one book that treats it specifically. Group work is the kind of thing that would get mentioned briefly or in passing.

>>33679266
Depends which ethical system you are following.
From a Jewish perspective, it would probably go something like the following:
>honey jar spells are sorcery which is forbidden
>in constrast stage magic and illusions are a permissible form of magic, provided you let people know it is an illusion
>you are also allowed to do magic for the purposes of personal spiritual development
>One Rabbi has commented it is probably okay to petition the heavens for your desires, however the heavens will probably take away a blessing from somewhere else if they give you desire, because the world is created with justice so petitioning the heavens is not a free cheat code to life, and God sees the bigger picture, so it's probably not worthwhile to do it to much
>however you are allowed to sin if you can deal with the consequences (ie severe judgements in response to sin, that the Old Testament is completely filled with examples of)
>the consequences for a honey jar probably wouldn't be that severe if your intent is pure, such as to restore a friendship that had grown cold.
>if the intent of the honey jar spell was impure, there could be much more severe consequences. Like if you bind someone in love against their will, a similar thing could happen to you, where you are forced in a relationship with someone you are not attracted to, and feel you lose years of your life and willpower in a situation like that.
>there are general curses against sorcery that are listed in the Old Testament. So even if you aren't actively harming others, still the heavens may decide to send some curses on you, and especially notable will be the curse of social isolation. However for one honey jar spell this might not kick in, but if you keep dabbling in magic it probably would at some point.

In Judaism it's a big ethical can of worms. The main thing to worry about is that if you harm someone else or restrict their freewill, you will likely be punished "eye for an eye", and no free lunch

There are different teachers saying different things, but one method is to completely sublimate the energies during the day, with extensive yoga practices, and then they will not cause problems at night.

There is a tier to celibacy:
>physical sexual sins: things like adultery and illegal types of sex, that are explicitedly prohibited in the Old Testament,
>mental sexual sins: Jesus says that to even look at a woman with lust is to commit adultery with her. There are similar teachings in Kabbalah and Eastern meditation systems. Watching porn would fall under this category, where the main person it harms is yourself.
>Semen Loss: Teachings in Kabbalah, as well as some yoga and meditation gurus, consider semen loss to be the worst sin, as it is typically the biggest thing preventing a man from rapid spiritual development. This is the spiritual meaning behind circumcision - the restriction of Yesod. Methods like "perineum lock" can easily prevent the loss of semen, while still allowing a deeply pleasurable sex life.
>Mental Celibacy: This is considered the peak of the celibacy ladder, but in yogic terms it involves a complete transformation of the body, so that sexual energies are naturally used to power higher spiritual powers.

Funnily enough, there are some claims that chanting mantras of Venus and/or Moon will allow one to easily have celibacy, perhaps because by understanding the nature of woman, their illusion is shattered, and it becomes like seeing a Venus fly trap. The honey is sweet to taste, but leads to death.
Some western alchemical writings also talk about how in the alchemical resurrection, our animal nature and sex drive, will be completely overpowered by our spiritual nature, and so we will be like the angels, not getting married. Or as Paul says in the New Testament, that the spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.

>>33680960
Very good questions. What you've seen is the trap of materialism. It's the error that arises when trying to define spiritual concepts based on physicality.

If you go down that road, it leads to slavery. For example, a murderer could put a gun to a hostages head and say
>I'll only kill this person if you don't give me money
Now what happens if nobody pays him so he shoots the hostage? Are we all "guilty" for that persons death?
Or similarly look at the classic "trolley problem".

The only solution to those puzzles I've ever found, and the thing which makes the most sense, is that "guilt" is defined by what's INSIDE you. Your intention.
The murderer created the un-winnable situation from his negative intentions. So no matter the outcome the guilt belongs to him and nobody else.

So to answer your question about eating meat, the answer is what your intentions are.
Do you eat meat because you like the idea of consuming the flesh of living things, while dominating them as a superior predator?
Or do you only do it because you "have to", while perhaps wishing there was an easier way to avoid it, because you do in fact still care about animals?

I would say only the 1st one is guilty of being "evil".
The 2nd one is just being caught in an un-winnable situation designed by someone else (and the world), and in my book is not "evil" at all.

>Is eating meat evil? Thousands of insects die to make vegan food too, is that also evil? If a forest was cut down to plant a farm and hundreds of animals lost their home, am I evil for buying vegetables in the store that came from that farm?
Are you willing to live the life you gave the animals, or not?
Honestly, I think that's all there is to it.
Living a life in a cage, only being allowed to walk around a little, having parts of your body cut off. It's a shitty way to live, I don't want to do that to others, I don't want it done to me.

But, on the other hand, a free range chicken with a bunch of room, with all the space to perform all it's normal instinctual behaviors...That's probably fine, for the most part. I would be fine with that life, especially if it was short and the death mostly painless.
Also, how about hunting?
Well, would I be happy living a life as a deer? Dying to a wolf?
Is that a "game" or "incarnation" I would be fine with? Dying relatively quickly? It's not like a prey animal suffers for months, not usually anyway.
Yeah, I'd be fine with that. That's fine.

So really I think what it comes down to is simple- factory farming is probably evil, since it's a burden we wouldn't put on ourselves, but family farms are probably fine.

For me, I eventually realized I was getting close to "pitying" animals. To avoid pitying them, I think we have to imagine ourselves living their lives. If you are comfortable living the life of a free range chicken, then eat their eggs and flesh. I would not want to be a factory farmed chicken or cow, so I will work towards avoiding that bullshit, it's pretty shitty.

>Is eating meat evil? Thousands of insects die to make vegan food too, is that also evil? If a forest was cut down to plant a farm and hundreds of animals lost their home, am I evil for buying vegetables in the store that came from that farm?

Your question is flawed. Most vegans like myself don't even necessarily think in such simplistic moralistic terms like "evil". In my case, I was someone who was raised in an omnivore culture and socialised into eating animal flesh in various forms without questioning it, and I enjoyed it. Because of modern mass industrial agriculture I'd never even seen an animal raised for slaughter. At some stage I made a mental, logical, emotional connection between eating this meat and the reality of the experience of animals who die for that food. Then I told myself that those animals probably lived pretty decent happy lives on farms and so on until a sudden and pretty painless death. At some stage, though, I looked into it and found that this isn't true - it's much more awful than any of that. It's simple empathy. I don't want others hurting or enslaving me. I wouldn't like someone firing a bolt-pistol into my brains, and my flesh being used for someone elses pleasure. Most of us are aware that humans transitioning to a different diet would involve lots of changes, and that there are moral issues including issue relating to the suffering of animals displaced by farming or insects killed in the production of food, etc. What we're doing is the most simple first step possible - we're saying "I won't eat any of this", sometimes we do this as I originally did, thinking that others would follow and that I'd send 'signals' through consumer culture so that the world would change - and this definitely did happen to some degree, many of us just want like the idea of participating in it, even if we feel things won't change. Many anti-vegan posters think they have a 'gotcha' moment with these questions, as if we aren't aware of them.

I had something happen at a hotel once. Short backstory I grew up out in the “backwoods” civilization was 45 minute drive and the family didn’t get out much, so I remember being very young and always enjoying the experience of hotels, I had a little more freedom there to walk around alone and there was usually stuff to do and people to see unlike out in the country. So anyways one year we had a vacation at disneyworld in Orlando, we couldn’t afford a disney hotel but we had a pretty decent chain hotel like holiday inn or something, multiple stories, indoor pool, lots of hallways but everything’s cheap plastic you get the picture. So here’s what happened

>it’s the first night at the hotel.
>after walking the theme park all day, I’m just excited to walk around the empty hotel at night
>it’s around midnight, parents are asleep, it’s time to go lurking
>most of night is pretty slow, I walk down to the indoor pool, no ones there. I see some older kids hanging in the lobby, too shy to go hang out so I keep walking
>walk pass hotel bar, it’s closed but there’s a tiny selection of arcade games adjacent to the entry
>play the fuck out of some hydro thunder, things are going well
>I start to get tired and hungry, I check my watch, holy crap it’s already passed 2 am, time to head back
>head to elevator, push button for my floor
>I walk around floor my room is on, something feels off, start to realize everything looks similar but I feel like the layout of the hallway is different or something
>figure I must have hit the wrong button, I’ll just make my way back to the elevator
>something in the back of my head tells me to keep going forward to look for elevator, not to backtrack
>I’ve been walking down the hallways for 10-15 minutes, made multiple right turns
>ok this is stupid I’m being stubborn I’ll just turn around and go back the way I came
>as soon as I turn around the hair stands up on the back of my neck
Cont 1/2

Thing was, the parking lot had been totally empty all night. He could see it the whole time from where he sat. So he gets up and walks outside, confused.
He said between the time he saw the headlights and then walked around the front desk to the front door the parking lot was completely dark again. No lighyd. No cars. He said he got hit by a wave of goosebumps. Was almost afraid to move lol. Just stayed there with his head sticking out the door for a sec, watching the traffic on the freeway. Okay, so. Sleep paralysis happens when you tend to try to stay alert. So, if you're focussing on waking up so hard for your alarm, or being like oh fuck I don't feel very comfortable, your subconscious mind will stay awake, but because you're laying still for so long your body falls asleep. That's why that happens. You can force sleep paralysis on yourself by just repeating a phrase in your mind with the intention of staying mentally awake and not moving your body during that. You'll start to get itchy and if you ignore those impulses you trick your brain into thinking you're asleep when you're not. Hope that clarifies things for you. Not paranormal though.

>Glowies
I think the basic principles for evaluating a hypothetical conspiracy apply here as much as anywhere.

The big problem with a large-scale campaign of paid shills is that it puts too many people in the loop, making leaks inevitable.
It also creates a paper-trail, which means you'd not only have those manpower requirements, but you'd have to falsify every bit of agency paper relating to what they're doing and what your department is spending money on.
And if all your high-ranking people are in on it, making the paperwork unnecessary, then that makes the loop even bigger with even more risk and leaks.
Not impossible, but increasingly difficult, and this line of thinking is how you end up concluding that one conspiracy runs the whole world (with no leaks).

Personally, I tend to assume we're dealing with fanatics from any one of the religions that label what we do as "pure evil".
Once you insert that "pure evil" label (also why I dislike the word "Demon"), you almost guarantee that there's gonna be at least a Stand-Alone Complex of isolated fanatics who sink a LOT of time into "combating us" any way they can.
And creating the impression of government persecution is certainly a tactic they would use.

It's a title of a short story by Harlan Elison "I have no mouth and I must scream".
It tells a story about a world where AI supercomputer gained consciousness, realized it will exists for all eternity and decided to get revenge on humans. It killed everyone but ~5 people, kept them immortal and tortured them for thousands of years. Story ends when one guy manages to kill the rest of the living people, thus preventing the AI Supercomputer from having more fun. AI turns the guy into a slime which is unable to hurt itself, so AI can torture that guy for all eternity.

It's well written and short, give it a go.

Here is an extremely persuasive argument for why NDEs are real:

https://youtu.be/U00ibBGZp7o

It makes a huge deal about the fact that NDErs are representative of the population as a whole, and that when people go deep into the NDE, they all become convinced. As this article points out:

https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/mysteries-consciousness/202204/does-afterlife-obviously-exist

>"Statistics collected show that the "deeper" the NDE the greater the percentage of those who come away certain of the existence of the afterlife. Among those with the deepest experiences 100 percent came away agreeing with the statement, "An afterlife definitely exists"."

Since NDErs are representative of the population as a whole, and they are all convinced, then 100% of the population become convinced that there is an afterlife when they have a sufficiently deep NDE themselves. And so would you, me, or anyone, including the most dogmatic atheists and skeptics, because it is VASTLY more self-evidently real than this brief little experience of life on Earth we have now. When you dream and wake up, you instantly realize that life is more real than your dreams. When you have an NDE, the same thing is happening, but on a higher level, as you immediately realize that life is the deep, deep dream and the NDE world is the undeniably real world by comparison.

One thing that makes it really complex was that it was a lucid dream and how every city was different from each other, how every person had their own personality and a lot of things that make me think that I connected to the consciousness of one of my previous lives instead of just being a dream.

As I said this felt like a lifetime or a really long time, in fact it took me 3 years from London till I reached those ruins. When I finally woke up I didn't even know who I was, I was completely lost because I thought that the real me was that woman who traveled across the US and the Atlantic Ocean to explore those ruins, it was such a weird experience.

posts.com:
Based on random memories I have that I'm told never happened, and soft past life regression through meditation, I think I was alive back in the late 50s or early 60s

I have a memory of being in a kitchen with yellow walls and getting the milk at the back door for my mom. Glass bottles in this little metal basket thing.

I remember the curtains were closed and the morning sun was shining through them. They were floral print and also yellow, though they may have been white and just aged to yellow.

In a regression meditation, I was outside. Small residential area. Gravel along the side of the road instead of side walks. I was in my bare feet. I think I was a teenager. Think I was female.

In this life, the sound of cars speeding triggers my fight or flight. Strangely, it's the flight reaction. It's strange because generally things trigger the fight reaction in me. I accidentally elbowed a female friend of mine in the gut once when we were 13 because she startled me from behind and it was just an instantaneous reaction.

I wonder if my dislike of wearing shoes might stem back to that past life though. Really can't stand not feeling the ground with my feet. I don't even put shoes on to go outside in the snow if I'm planning on only being outside for a short time, like to take out trash

Tl;Dr
Might have been some random hippie girl last time round

>>33655186
The ancient Lyrans were titans, standing 20 to 30 feet tall, from a planet much greater in size than ours. They were white-skinned, with blond hair, usually had blue eyes, and had a life span of around 2,000 years.
They were a warlike race that had not only developed technically, but were quite advanced in the use of spiritual power. They moved their warlike forces around the galaxy and used their great power to take control of many thousands of lesser-developed races.

Over the years the Lyran blood line was mixed with other civilizations, creating many different colors and races which spread throughout the galaxy.

Just as their race was at its highest peak of advancement, a huge destructive comet that became known as the Destroyer Comet found its way into the Lyran family of planets, and two-thirds of their race were killed.
The last fly past by the Destroyer was in 1680. If this is correct, it is likely that it is the comet we know as "The Great Comet of 1680": The first ever comet discovered by telescope.

Along with the destruction, their technology was wiped out, and they were unable to continue to exercise control over the great empire they had built. The great Lyran Empire had degenerated back to one planet with no technology to speak of.
They were barely able to survive and were faced with the task of rebuilding a civilization which once dominated thousands of other worlds.

After thousands of years, the Lyrans restored their society and again became a dominant force in the Galaxy. Pleiadian history documents that he Lyrans went through a series of civilizations over a period of several millions of years. It was their pattern to rise to power, begin to fight among themselves, and then degenerate into a primitive society and start all over again. On some occasions their wars were so brutal that it took millions of years for them to recover from the primitive state left by the destruction.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664746
It wasn't until 387,000 B.C. that the Lyrans once again had an effect on Earth. Another war had ravaged Lyra, and many of those on the losing side had fled for safety. They travelled through the cosmos and came to Earth as a place of sanctuary.
It was peaceful here; the local humans were primitive and offered no resistance to their high technology. It was decided they would stay and build a colony.

Back home in Lyra it was discovered that a large group had fled to Earth, and ships were dispatched to come after them. Upon arriving at Earth they were disgusted and appalled to find the conditions that prevailed here. The local Earth-humans were being used as slaves and were being mistreated badly. Many were being used in experiments where they were being mated with animals, while others were being disfigured, raped, or maimed.
The colony was an example of the darkest side of man. Living in degeneration and filth, it was decided to leave the colony on Earth, take away all of their technology, including their space ships, and leave the 144,207 Lyran soldiers to their own fate on Earth.

This colony died out after several thousand years, and the spirits of the Lyran soldiers that were left behind became part of the spirit world of Earth. The 144,207 degenerate Lyran soldiers would now be incarnating here along with the original inhabitants.

The effect they would have on Earth would forever steer it away from a normal evolution.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664910
Lyran history continued to repeat itself for thousands of years until, after restoring themselves once again to a high level of technology; they built flight machines with beamdrives and once again moved out into the cosmos. Their leaders were great scientists with an understanding of spiritual power, so once again they began to conquer other races. Their leaders soon realized the unlimited powers of the spiritual forces and developed them until they became masters of these great forces, becoming known as an ISHWISH (IHWH), meaning "god" or "king of wisdom."
The great power of their spirit allowed them to live for thousands of years, and they ruled over countless civilizations.

The Ishwish leaders ruled with cruel power, and eventually the public started a civil uprising. The war lasted for almost four centuries, causing the death of more than 60% of the population and nearly destroying the three worlds of the Lyra system. It seemed that no one in the Lyra systems would escape this slaughter that raged 230,000 years ago.

An Ishwish named Asael could see the end coming and fled from the wars with 360,000 people in 183 great spaceships, capable of transporting over a thousand passengers each, and 250 small space reconnaissance ships that could carry a crew of three. This group of Lyrans wandered through space for many years until they came across a star system with 254 still young, blue suns. There were already a few colonized planets with primitive people living there, but they were no threat to the great Lyran technology. They landed and built their new society on three different planets around a star they called Taygeta.
Life was hard and difficult, and it took 300 years or their civilization to grow and adapt to their new environment.

Millions of Lyrans fled the great wars and settled in Orion, Hyades and the Pleiades.

posts.name: Anonymouse
posts.com:
>>33664930
After the new civilization developed, Asael commanded that they start to explore and conquer other worlds again, just as they had done in Lyra.
The powerful beamdrive ships sped out into open space and once main established a reign of tyranny over planets of less-developed beings and brought them under their control. It was during this time that they came into the system known as the Hesperides.

A young, underdeveloped form of human life was there and was quickly conquered and fell under Asael's ruler ship.
The Lyrans once again were exercising their power over others and beginning to force their rule throughout the galaxy. It seems that the forces of greed and power were inbred well into the Lyrans, considering that peace seemed to escape them time after time.
There had been millions of years of bloodshed and wars, and still they had not learned to get along peacefully with other races.

The Ancient Lyrians split off to Orion, Hyades, and the Pleiades and started new colonies.
The planets of the Pleiades soon flourished and spread out to Earth, Mars, Hesperides, and Milona.

Seventy years of conquering had diminished Asael's lust for power, and his life of bloodthirsty rule came to an end as the father of the Pleiades passed away. Control of the new race of the Pleiades fell to his daughter Pleja, an Ishrish, (the female form of an Ishwish) who, like her father, had the blood of a warrior.

Eager to build their great society even farther, the ordered the exploration ships to again seek out new worlds that could fall under her rule.
As the ships moved out into space once again to explore, they came across the trail of the Destroyer Comet which so many years ago had been the destructive force that had ended the Lyran Empire. Contained within the tail of the great comet, they discovered debris from the planets of ancient Lyra.

It was decided to follow the comet for awhile and study its path of violence.

posts.com:

This was the destructive force that had changed the history of Lyra and caused death on thousands of worlds, and now it had brought the warriors from the Pleiades into a small sun system and the home of a little planet called Earth.

To their surprise, they discovered a small group of uncivilized people living there. Some were brown-skinned and could be traced to the origin of life on Earth. Others were of mixed color, but most were white-skinned and had a Lyran spirit-form. The Pleiadians had stumbled onto a colony founded by their ancient Lyran ancestors who had degenerated into a primitive society. Awed by their discovery of human life and common ancestry, it was decided to colonize three different planets in the system and continue the family chain. News of their discovery was sent back to the home planets and apparently sparked an interest in Pleja, for she ordered a great migration to be undertaken. Within a very short time thousands of travelers from tie Pleiades came and created societies on Earth, Mars, and Milona.
Milona was a planet which existed beyond the orbit of Mars at that time.

It was only a few short years before a small war raged on Earth, and many of the scientists left to return to the Pleiades, leaving the three planets to grow on their own.

Pleja was unhappy with this and did not want her new colonies to be destroyed, so she dispatched a fleet to stop the war, and things calmed down again.

>>33682928
Yes. The set of numbers between 0 and 1 (or more generally, any infinite set of Real numbers) is a larger infinity than the infinite set of all integers (...-2,-1,0,1,2...).
>0.9999... =/= 1
Since there's no number that separates them one way of looking at it is that they're the same number, but another way of looking at it is that there's an infinite set between them and the infinity of 0.999... approaching 1 is "slower" than the infinity separating the two numbers. At least that's one layman's understanding, been a long time since I read about this and I've definitely simplified parts.

You're on the wrong track, 1/3 can be represented as a fraction while 0.999999... can't be represented as a fraction, it's a limit, the limit of a number approaching 1 from the left. 1/3 and 0.333333... are just different ways of representing the same number, although no one uses the second notation when you can write 1/3. posts.com:
My dear friends, the first noble truth: life is duhkha.

Often duhkha is interpreted as suffering and that can be ok but I think the common western understanding of suffering doesn't quite encompass what is really meant by duhkha. Lack of fulfillment, hollowness, discontent, constant grasping to fill a void.

As you say, this inner infirmity and impotency causes us to seek distraction. Anything to cover up this inner lack.

Well there is a way to fil the void so to speak and it isn't through grasping. The truth is that we are already full and whole, but that we have forgotten this fact.

We have become distracted by ideas, concepts, desires. The constructs of our own mind binds us. The ego enslaves us through its attachments. All of this occurs unconsciously, for if we became conscious of our true nature then all duhkha would disappear.

There is a way beyond the illness and it is dissolution - but perhaps not in the way possibly implied by the op.

Just sharing my experience.
I was in the TAG program and also early speech therapy. I don't think they ever had me drink anything but I also have trouble remembering. The speech therapy room was weird and mostly empty with no windows for sure, I remember it being strange but at the age didn't think much of it. What I remember of TAG however was more for group projects and presentations. They had us do a play about slavery. In the play I was a robot from the future that came back to tell the slave owners that slavery is wrong. It was stupid and I distinctly remember it being stupid, none of us kids were really into it but we played our parts anyway. I'm a very empathetic person with genuine empath abilities (honestly I kinda hate them sometimes) that noticeably manifested themselves in my late 20s, though I think they've been there since I was born. Emotions have always affected me physically to some degree. When I was really little and something would hurt my feelings it would become an indescribable discomfort in my throat. Late teens and early 20s were extreme drug and alcohol abuse. I ended up hooked on opiates for a few years. I broke free from that though, cold turkey with literally no outside support. Hard but not impossible.
Anyway, I bring up that TAG was for group projects, but this was a little later in elementary school, like 4th grade. I know for sure there was one on one time between me and the instructors but I 100% can't remember any of it. Closest I remember is walking down to the area where they did TAG stuff. I recall the TAG stuff wasn't in the windowless room, they used the library instead. But I can't remember a single fucking thing we did during TAG in those early years. The play is the only thing I remember.

>>33664297
Your confusion comes from not really understanding what astrology actually is.

Astrology is an interpretive science where you must link causation to correlation. You have to, judging by the placements for the event under consideration, isolate the particular matters you are concerned about from both the chart and the real life situation, and then apprehend the particular manifestation of that matter in this instance and identify the features unique to it. You must both draw a commonality between this instance and other instances of the exact same placement, as well as rationally distinguish this kind of situation from other placements concerning the same sort of matter.

In the distant past long before astrology was "settled", the planets presumably had no names, or at the very least not descriptive ones that denoted any symbolism to use. They looked up at the cosmos and charted what they saw without any inkling of what it meant. At some point, some people noticed that certain things happened when certain cosmological objects were in particular spots in space. They investigated the link between human psychology and cosmological placements and eventually were able to associate aspects of human behavior with influences astrological bodies were apparently exerting.

They deduced that the body known as Mercury seemed to be affecting the particular ways people rationally think and communicate; and looking at the zodiac signs, the influence seemed to come out most emblematically in Gemini, who are known for thinking and speaking miles ahead of everyone else, and who seem to find their life's fulfillment in these activities.

The system established early on that every astrological body around Earth must have an influence upon the beings upon it. That only leaves the question of what each one does, ascertained through intense study: not of your textbooks, but of your case studies: astrology as a science is exegesis; it's not an "art" where meaning's created.

Venus in domicile Libra perhaps creates a self-indulgent character, one that is concerned with personal pleasure first and will also manipulate others to serve one's personal happiness.

If you've never once obsessed over anything intellectual or complex and came out of it with a very advanced and above average understanding of it relative to other people, then you will probably continue to live your life with wasted potential. >>33665072
Exaltation is a discovered placement that has the effect of taking the planet's energies and getting rid of most if not all of the bad parts and only keeping the good.

Imagine you have a lion as a guard animal. The domicile is the lion's master and it mostly obeys its will but ocassionally gets out of control and bites what it isn't supposed to.
Detriment, it doesn't obey at all, it does little to nothing for it, neither good or bad.
Fall, it's mostly hostile and attacks the native more than it obeys.
Exaltation is like having a leash, a whip, catnip, the whole nine yards for keeping it under control and getting it to do precisely whatever you command it to. It's not its master per se but because it isn't its "baby" the native doesn't treat it with kiddy gloves when it gets out of line; the planet is its samurai, sworn to serve the exalted in utter obeisance.

Exaltation is getting all of the benefit of a planet's energy/influence but without the danger of being overtaken by it. A domicile gets the full expression of the energy, and that necessarily includes the unsavory parts.

Yes, that is correct.

The Ego is of course what we would traditionally call someone's personality. It is the foundation of who that person is and how they consciously behave for the very most part. This is why in laymen's understanding everything beyond the sun sign is secondary or irrelevant, because the Sun as Ego constitutes much of what we can know about ourselves and others without much observation and analysis.

The Superego in a Freudian model is concerned with regulating and directing behavior, arbitrating between what one wishes to do and what one ought to do. The Ascendant lends a sense of ought to one's personality and will be the voice in your head throughout your life telling you what to do.

The Ascendant has been called the persona, the image we project to the world especially to strangers, the mask and pretense that obscures the ego from initial view, but that's not wholly accurate. In unfamiliar territory, the ascendant steps in to regulate how we proceed---it leads the way and guides the rest of the self behind it. But its role doesn't stop there. The ascendant, again, charts the course for your approach to life, your inward feeling of lifepath.

Midheaven I haven't quite figured out yet. Nor IC for that matter. But as of right now, given the common assumption that it has to do with career and thus self-assertion upon and self-insertion within society, I think MC might be associated with ambition and work.

If the ascendant is the ideation of a "calling", then the midheaven perhaps might be the physicality of that calling: again, the "work" you'll end up wanting to do.

>>33668030
These two perspectives aren't mutually exclusive.

Master--Servant, Actor/Agent--Environment

This is the first time I've ever heard your metaphor/analogy. It requires Tarot-like thinking where you assign archetypes to everything. If the Sun is a king, then what is *Jupiter* supposed to be? It's fraught with such unsolved mystery.

My conception of the relationship makes the planet an Equip Spell card and each zodiac sign is a Monster card of its own unique type. You have the planets as the Monster cards and the signs as Field Spell cards.

My intention was to show how each sign is its own person who wields the planets like weapons. Think of Soul Calibur, how each weapon is as unique as each character, and how some skill with one weapon may translate into a certain amount of skill with another and badness with yet another. The difference is that nobody presumably would ever be stronger using someone else's weapon than they would be with their own, which they mastered.

On the contrary, here I am saying that domicile is the placement where you are naturally gifted at an untrained level: thus there is an inherent lack of discipline at play and bad habits will reveal themselves. The exaltation is a placement where the planet is wielded by someone who has been trained and ordained to wield it most *effectively*, which specifically means not using it any old which way that it might lend itself to: the notion that just because something can do a thing doesn't mean it should do a thing.

See this example: Mars is full well capable of the nuclear option, so to speak, and Aries will find itself inclined to hit the button regularly. But Capricorn understands you ought not use nukes willy nilly and have to use them strategically, if at all. It has been disciplined in the art of Mars such that it can utilize the tools in its box for maximun effectiveness in its mission, and let alone the tools also in there that aren't optimal.

It's the worst sign for the Moon.
Represents jealousy, spite, grudges, malice, unhappyness, unsatisfiable desires, evil subconscious mind, desire to backstab people, and many similar things.
So while Moon-Taurus is a happy person who also makes others happy, Moon-Scorpio is an unhappy, envious person, who makes others unhappy, and makes passive aggressive comments about them, and stabs them in the back, and nothing people do for them can really please them as they are naturally unhappy people.
The vices of the Moon rather than the virtues.

Ussually the bad traits are worse when people are young, but they slightly improve with age, especially if the person is trying to improve their faults.
It's also a huge redflag for a woman in a relationship, as Moon-Scorpio will dominate her personality in old age (while the sweetnessof Venus will entrap a person into her snares), and so very high risk of an unhappy nagging wife who causes a lot of unhappyness and strife in the family.
It's not as much of a red flag for a man to have, because the Moon is a less dominant part of their personality compared to woman.

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:

SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

WILD is going to be much harder if you're attempting it going to sleep after staying up the entire day. The first rem cycle happens like 2 hours into sleep. If you ever wake up in the middle of the night because you have to pee or something, that's when you should do it.

The light show was trying to unnerve me, as the light that was coming through my doorway was shaping itself in such a way as if my door was opening letting in even more light and an implied "something else" along with it. This could imply about 2.5 things.
1.) She was basically implying I wouldn't have asked that on my own and that my sister put me up to it.
2a.) The concept of time holds no meaning. The only reason we have time on planet earth is due to the rotational spin of the globe. 1 day is 24 hours and 1 year is 365 days through pure chance. How does one keep track of what year it is on another planet, much less in a dream world where time can behave differently and people can dream a year or even more in just the short timespan of a night.
2b.) This world isn't real, and she knows that I know (or at least that I heavily suspect it)
Either way, I want to make it very clear that I was 100% awake when I heard those sounds and saw those flashes of light, but what is it that I'm supposed to listen to? Well that's all, thanks for reading my blog. What do you guys think? (2/2)

>>33678302
>2.)
That's sleep paralysis followed by HH. Your body fell asleep while your mind was awake so it layered dream hallucinations on top of it.
>The only reason we have time on planet earth is due to the rotational spin of the globe
Ackshually, time exists regardless of Earth. Atoms gonna atom, and much of physics wouldn't work if time wasn't real.
>1 day is 24 hours and 1 year is 365 days through pure chance
There's nothing chance about that, unless you're talking about the Earth's position affecting those particular numbers. The numbers themselves were derived from physical measurements of how fast the sun moves across the sky from our perspective, and how many days it takes for the seasons to cycle. There's no significance to them specifically.
>How does one keep track of what year it is on another planet
For Earth years on another planet you'd use an atomic clock. It doesn't matter where in the universe you are, Caesium's still going to vibrate at the same speed. Otherwise you'd use the planet's own measurements for days/years which might be longer or shorter, but you'd still live the same absolute time (if a year was half the duration you'd live twice as many years).
The whole thing sounds like general dream nonsense to me, anion.

>Ackshually, time exists regardless of Earth. Atoms gonna atom, and much of physics wouldn't work if time wasn't real.
Of course time exists. What I meant was that (as you said) the only reason a day is 24 hours and a year is 365 days is due to the rotation of the earth and how long it takes to orbit the sun. Dreams however are different though. You can experience a years worth of time in half a night, or even more. It doesn't make much sense to assume that time works the same way within a dream.
>For Earth years on another planet you'd use an atomic clock. It doesn't matter where in the universe you are, Caesium's still going to vibrate at the same speed
Furthermore to elaborate how do you measure the time on earth from within a dream? From within a dream it is impossible to measure time in this world since they're not even on the same realm.
Let me put it this way for you. Assume both Earth and Venus have the same starting date of Day 1, year 1 upon Earth reaching AD on the calendar. Can you tell me what year and month it is on Venus currently without looking it up? This isn't even taking into account the finnicky nature of time in a dream. So pretty much my whole point is that it makes no sense a person in a dream would ever know what the date here is.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

posts.com:
>>33633518
Monk anon here. Meditation is a tool to understand the nature of the mind. To train ourselves to see things as they really are. It's really that simple. The reason we suffer so much is because we don't understand the nature of the mind. We don't realize how conditioned we are, the conditioning is the basis for stress and anxiety. When we watch the mind for a long enough time, we begin to understand it, we begin to notice the habitual patterns. We notice how external stimuli aren't the real cause of our anger, for example. The problem isn't that something is what it is, the problem is that we don't want it to be that way, or want it to be some other way. We learn that we're actually creating our own problems when we could just let it go. We learn that we aren't our thoughts. Thoughts are just there, the problems begin when we identify with and take them personally as "these thoughts are me." Ultimately, your mind and thoughts are working against you, until you can break the conditioning and snap out of these delusions. This actually takes more work than anyone here is willing to do. Many people see "meditation" as a quick self help fix or relaxation technique, bit they won't have any meaningful or long lasting results from their efforts. Meditation has to be developed along side morality and wisdom. It's a tripod and none will work without the others. This means that probably 99.9% of people are wasting their time with meditation, because most people can't or simply won't bother with the morality and wisdom aspect. They aren't willing to let go completely.

>>3364053
For morality? Pick a religious/spiritual/occult/philosophical school of thought with a moral code that genuinely resonates with you and start living it. The Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes are similarly very straight forward and easy to grasp without requiring any mental gymnastics to avoid hypocrisy. Morality really isn't as complicated as modern religious culture makes it out to be. Don't harm yourself or others. Don't help others harm themselves. Provide help when requested. Don't offer help or advice when not qualified or requested. I.E.
>"love" (commit to the well being of) your neighbors
Morality in a nutshell. Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes break it down slightly more clearly since Christ's proverb is apparently very easy to misunderstand. Same idea though.

For wisdom? There are countless ways. This mostly just requires life experience, reflection, and empathy. Meditating daily and bringing your baseline conscious experience closer and closer to a meditative state is a slow but reliable method. You'll be well ahead of the curve if you are able to fully comprehend and live this old Buddhist proverb:
>I am a finger pointed at the moon
>do not look at me, look at the moon
The truth is everywhere in plain sight. Look for the truth in everything, not the lies in everything.

Feeling something is an entirely different thing from thinking, you may feel fear but you may think hateful thoughts, you may feel happiness but you may think that happiness is wrong.

I used to be an over-thinking person with an overactive mind, I'd analyze anything, I'd daydream all day long e.t.c.

Turning off my mind was scary for me, feeling my feelings was scary for me, I hated feeling anything (be it happiness, fear, sorrow) because I thought that I couldn't handle those feelings.

I remember when I began meditating, I was focusing on my breath but most of the time I was just thinking about my breath or me about focusing on the breath, or I was thinking about the feelings my breath left on my body, it took me some time to just FEEL my breath.

I still haven't answered your question and truth be told I don't have a solid answer, the closer I can get to is this: Feeling is one of your abilities, just how thinking is, just don't try to analyze/think about feeling because that is not feeling, feeling is just feeling something, there is no "wrong" or "right" feeling. Society teaches that it's "wrong" to feel sadness or sorrow or anger, those are just thought-words that others taught you, THERE IS NO WRONG FEELING, there is only feeling.
And lastly: Feeling only happens in the here and now, so I'd say that feeling is a more "grounded" ability than thinking.

I hope what I said makes some sense, if not ask me again.

I'm late to the party but here's what you do. Sit crossed legged or in a chair with your back straight. Put your attention gently on the breath. Don't intensely force your attention to stay on it. Eventually you will notice your mind is wandering. Take a brief moment to acknowledge this and return your attention to the breath. If it helps, you can mentally says "in" and "out" as you breathe in and out, or "beginning" and "end" to mark the beginning and end of each in and out breath.

This is the starting technique in >>33643926 which I also highly recommend reading.

>What are some good ways to meditate?

general idea: mind has to process input from 1sensory organs, 2thoughts and 3instincts

task: dim down as far as you can those 3 (resolve your issues)
tip: breathing is the most basic function, cheapest, simplest starting point you can focus on

posts.sub: What is the true nature of beauty?
posts.com: Is something being "beautiful" really subjective or do it has some objectivity?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33678425
Words don't have inherent meaning, only the meaning we interpret them to have. So in that sense it depends on how you define "beauty".
There's nothing stopping someone from defining "beauty" as a list of objective rigid requirements.

However, if you ask me I say the only definition of "beauty" that's meaningful is a subjective definition.
Because the _purpose_ of beauty is to invoke feelings. And checking off a list of objective properties doesn't guarantee feeling.
So it doesn't matter of some aesthetic is _supposed_ to make me feel something, if I don't _actually_ feel it then the objective definition failed.

peace is in silence and stillness. give up thoughts. they do nothing for you. you understand more without them and you'll feel better. look for the space between your thoughts and then expand it. concentrate on the feelings in your body, the sensation of your body. relax all the tension in your body every time you remember to, because a relaxed body is a happy mind. find that state of mind where you see the world without labels or concepts, that state of mind where everything is Ahhhhhhh wonder and awe, because it is only concepts and language that take you out of the natural joy of living.

the natural state of living is joy and wonder. everything else is a cloud that sits on top of it, obscuring it.

learn to be present. if you insist on continuing to think, ask yourself what good it has done you. also consider that there are happy people out there worse off than you. how? because a good life is a state of mind. the thinking mind is good for making choices and changing your perspective, but it needs to be controlled or else it runs a man into the ground.

watch some eckhart tolle videos for quick advice on being present.

I found the error in the programming.
A compression reduces complexity by removing all stimuli extraneous to itself.

Here's an example.
I just walked outside and stood in the cold.
The cold reminded me of a time when I jumped into a spring, on a hot summer's day. My entire body became hot, despite the cold.

Earlier in my life, I was walking on ice, and I thought to myself, "I wonder how far I can get without pushing off the ground?". I felt to a memory of me skating in an ice rink, and though I was wearing shoes, I was floating, and walked for 10 minutes before coming to my senses, and realizing I had been walking without exerting any effort.

This must be at least one type of magic. Locking on to a memory in the past and using that memory to remove present barriers of physics.

Of course, these are somewhat "within reason" but have any of you done something similar?

Also, Merry Christmas!

posts.name: The Laughing Lad

>>33674673
>>"Who are you?"

God and an incarnation/idea that has spent a lot of time looking for him.

>>"How'd you come to learn this?"

Desire. Luck. Destiny. Open mindedness. Closed mindedness. Little by little. A mind that tries to see the links and connections between everything. Fear and fearlessness. Cowardice and bravery.

>>"How'd you remember it after you learned it?"

Its a process of gradual culmination. Everything in my life, in one way or another is in service of the Godhead. It is hard to fathom the exact set of actions and interests and coincidences and realisations and epiphanies and incidents that go towards having knowledge of these things AND the ability to remember them. But look at the patterns and you will see them. For example why is martial arts constantly linked to spirituality when those things should by all rights be at odds? How does the want to have sex lead to tantra? How does psychological stress or physical injury lead to divine knowledge? How does interest in conspiracy eventually lead to shamanism? How does looking at a blade of grass lead to enlightenment.

There are many paths up the mountain but for this to work you have to really want to get up to the top of the mountain.

The glory of God sings itself from every part of existence.

Are we listening?

So say someone took a substance like 5MEO-DMT.

They may get to experience they are God.

If they are lucky or destined they may bring back their lessons and that knowledge in some shape or form. But if they havent spent a great deal of time trying to understand the nature of reality and in a sense preparing for it (as a human incarnation I mean) then they will probably not be able to remember it in any significant way or will remember a stepped down version or particular part of the experience, or even remember themselves fighting a giant serpent that represents their ego or some such symbolic display.

And beyond all that…I am talking nonsense.

Extreme fear of death is actually a good thing, it will make you search for the truth more. While you may feel awful now its gonna be a great motivation to open your mind. I had a big fear of death since i was around 13, but at 18 something happened and i had insane existential dread, it happened while i was in the middle of a game. I was literally feeling sick while thinking about death. I tried to go and vomit but i couldn't. Then every day for the next 2 weeks i was in extreme despair. Even the food had no taste. I was trying to go on walks and cope somehow with the materialistic worldview with things like "matter can't be created or destroyed so we will still be in some form somehow" etc. Its been a while since then but i'm now pretty convinced death isn't what people think it is. I think the universe is mental but im not gonna try to convince anyone.
I personally am happy that i had to go through that existential dread (the most extreme one being the first one for 2 weeks) to get where i am now.

posts.name: Barggeist
posts.com:
>>33679663
To recap, there are three main types of niacin supplements that you can use.

One is immediate release, IR.

The next is extended release, ER.

The last is sustained release, SR.

IR will immediately allow the niacin to enter the bloodstream, this will cause flushing in majority of cases.

ER usually has a special coating that makes it harder to dissolve, and because of that it reduces or stops flushing.

SR relies on the liver to give a sustained amount of niacin. The initial form is not niacin, and when the liver starts processing the supplement it becomes niacin. Of course, it also means the liver needs to work harder to process the niacin afterwards.

IR or ER are both good choices for the protocol, however I would strongly oppose using SR because it puts significantly more stress on the liver. For some, it could potentially be dangerous to use SR at the dosages the maintenance protocol recommends.

Even using IR or ER niacin at high dosages of 1000mg daily isn't sustainable long term, which is why the maintenance protocol has a break phase.
